name: Channel realignment
functionStatement: Examines the role of bank processes and erosion in channel change. Observes patterns in sinuosity and curvature affecting habitat complexity.
descriptionMarkdown: Assesses whether planform and number of active threads match the natural setting, considering straightening, braiding, and side-channel connectivity.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compare current and historical imagery or maps to identify straightened or ditched segments and quantify percent altered.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 0-10% of reach is artificially realigned, or only minor evidence of channelization.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 10-25% of reach shows signs of straightening or dredging.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 25-50% of reach is artificially realigned with major loss of natural planform.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: >50% of reach is straightened or ditch-like.

references: USGS historic topographic maps (TopoView) and multi-date NAIP or Google Earth imagery.
